meanings.definition: The state of lacking a definite or recognizable shape or structure.
meanings.sent1: The artist captured the formlessness of the clouds in his painting.
meanings.sent2: The formlessness of the dough made it challenging to shape into a perfect circle.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's attempt at building a sandcastle resulted in a delightful formlessness.
meanings.sent4: In the darkness, the shadows took on a mysterious formlessness.
meanings.sent5: The fog enveloped the city in a shroud of formlessness, hiding everything from view.

meanings.definition: The quality of being shapeless or without a distinct form.
meanings.sent1: The artist's sculpture portrayed the beauty of formlessness in a unique way.
meanings.sent2: The formlessness of the jellyfish allowed it to move gracefully through the water.
meanings.sent3: The pile of clothes on the floor seemed to have a life of its own, embracing its formlessness.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts swirled in a state of formlessness, making it hard to focus on any one idea.
meanings.sent5: The dream depicted a world where everything existed in a state of eternal formlessness.
